exceptions.exn: In environment X, Y : Type S, R, T : relation2 X Y Unable to unify "star ?M1495 ?M1497 ?M1498" with "incl R R /\\ incl R R".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
Y: Type
X: Type
T: relation2 X Y
R: relation2 X Y
S: relation2 X Y

Goal:
eeq R R

Premises:
relation2 = fun X Y : Type => X -> Y -> Prop : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments relation2 (_ _)%type_scope
eeq : forall X Y : Type, relation (relation2 X Y)
comp_eeq : forall (X Y Z : Type) (R' : relation2 X Y) (S' : relation2 Y Z) (R : relation2 X Y) (S : relation2 Y Z), eeq R R' -> eeq S S' -> eeq (comp R S) (comp R' S')
union2_eeq : forall (X Y : Type) (R' R1' R R1 : relation2 X Y), eeq R R' -> eeq R1 R1' -> eeq (union2 R R1) (union2 R' R1')
trans_eeq : forall (X Y : Type) (R' R : relation2 X Y), eeq R R' -> eeq (trans R) (trans R')
ssrfun.tagged2' : forall w : {x : ?I & ?T_ x & ?U_ x}, ?U_ (ssrfun.tag2 w) where ?I : [X : Type Y : Type S : relation2 X Y R : relation2 X Y T : relation2 X Y |- Type] ?T_ : [X : Type Y : Type S : relation2 X Y R : relation2 X Y T : relation2 X Y |- ?I -> Type] ?U_ : [X : Type Y : Type S : relation2 X Y R : relation2 X Y T : relation2 X Y |- ?I -> Type]
union_eeq : forall (I X Y : Type) (F' F : I -> relation2 X Y), (forall i : I, eeq (F i) (F' i)) -> eeq (union F) (union F')
comp_incl : forall (X Y Z : Type) (R' : relation2 X Y) (S' : relation2 Y Z) (R : relation2 X Y) (S : relation2 Y Z), incl R R' -> incl S S' -> incl (comp R S) (comp R' S')
trans_incl : forall (X Y : Type) (R' R : relation2 X Y), incl R R' -> incl (trans R) (trans R')
union2_incl : forall (X Y : Type) (R' R1' R R1 : relation2 X Y), incl R R' -> incl R1 R1' -> incl (union2 R R1) (union2 R' R1')
union2 : forall X Y : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 X Y -> relation2 X Y
comp : forall X Y Z : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 Y Z -> relation2 X Z
eta2 : forall X Y : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 X Y
trans : forall X Y : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 Y X
relation = fun X : Type => relation2 X X : Type -> Type Arguments relation _%type_scope
union : forall X Y I : Type, (I -> X -> Y -> Prop) -> relation2 X Y
star_ind : forall (X : Type) (R : relation X) (P : X -> X -> Prop), (forall x : X, P x x) -> (forall y x z : X, R x y -> star R y z -> P y z -> P x z) -> forall x x0 : X, star R x x0 -> P x x0
Inductive star (X : Type) (R : relation X) : relation X := star_refl : forall x : X, star R x x | S_star : forall y x z : X, R x y -> star R y z -> star R x z Arguments star [X]%type_scope Arguments star_refl [X]%type_scope Arguments S_star [X]%type_scope [R y] _ [z]
union_incl : forall (I X Y : Type) (F' F : I -> relation2 X Y), (forall i : I, incl (F i) (F' i)) -> incl (union F) (union F')
plus_eeq : forall (X : Type) (T' T : relation X), eeq T T' -> eeq (plus T) (plus T')
star_eeq : forall (X : Type) (T' T : relation X), eeq T T' -> eeq (star T) (star T')
Ring_theory.pow_pos : forall R : Type, (R -> R -> R) -> R -> BinNums.positive -> R
Ring_polynom.r_list_pow : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> R -> R) -> list (R * BinNums.positive) -> R
Ring_polynom.mkmult_rec : forall R : Type, (R -> R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> R -> list (R * BinNums.positive) -> R

Field_theory.AF_AR : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req
Ring_polynom.mkmult1 : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> (R -> R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> list (R * BinNums.positive) -> R
Ring_theory.radd_ext2_Proper : forall (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req (Morphisms.respectful req req)) radd

Field_theory.rsub_ext_Proper : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req (Morphisms.respectful req req)) rsub
Field_theory.rsub_0_r : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> forall r : R, req (rsub r rO) r
Field_theory.rsub_0_l : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> forall r : R, req (rsub rO r) (ropp r)
PeanoNat.Nat.le_ind_rel : forall R : Relation_Definitions.relation nat, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq (Morphisms.respectful eq iff)) R -> (forall m : nat, R 0 m) -> (forall n m : nat, n <= m -> R n m -> R (Datatypes.S n) (Datatypes.S m)) -> forall n m : nat, n <= m -> R n m
Field_theory.NPEequiv : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Prop
Ring_theory.Radd_0_l : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x
Ring_theory.Ropp_def : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x : R, req (radd x (ropp x)) rO
Ring_theory.Radd_comm : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x)
Ring_theory.ARopp_zero : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> req (ropp rO) rO
Ring_theory.ARsub_def : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y : R, req (rsub x y) (radd x (ropp y))
S_star : forall (X : Type) (R : relation X) (y x z : X), R x y -> star R y z -> star R x z
